intro: Chisocheton sarawakanus, commonly known as the Sarawak hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Borneo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in tropical regions.
